name: Fraser Suites Perth

reviews.text: I stayed in a Studio room here last Saturday night instead of my regular Hotel as I wanted to try something different.
reviews.title: Clean and modern but not good if you’re a light sleeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good location

reviews.text: Very clean room and bathroom, modern decor, flat screen TV, and it was very convenient having a kitchenette. No traffic noise in the room. I was also able to park near the premises free of charge because it was a Saturday, which was also a bonus (a fee is charged between 8am to 6pm weekdays). I found the staff friendly and helpful and breakfast was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice but could have been better

reviews.text: Bad points:
reviews.title: Very clean, spacious and modern.

reviews.text: The one major flaw is the proximity of the rooms to the elevators. When booking, I asked for a room located away from the elevators and was pleased when on check-in I was advised that this request had been honoured. When I stepped out onto the 15th floor, I walked about 5 to 6 metres from the elevators and there was my room, facing the elevators. I thought there had been a mistake and was about to go back to reception until I studied the floor plan hanging on the wall and discovered that this Hotel is a rectangle shape and the elevators are in the middle of the Hotel. All rooms are therefore situated around the elevators. This will not be an issue for many, but I am a very light sleeper and found the “ding dong” of the elevator bell, plus the voice system in them announcing the floor number to be very annoying. Around midnight a couple of very noisy guests got out the elevators and made their way back to their room, waking me up. I had just got back to sleep when another group of very noisy guests came out the elevators laughing extremely loudly at 12.45am because someone had lost their access key card and couldn’t use the elevator. The loud discussion, constant laughing and ensuing phone call made it impossible to sleep. I realise that loud inconsiderate guests are in no way the fault of management, but this is the main reason why I prefer accommodation where you are not right next to elevators. The rooms behind the elevators are probably a lot quieter, but studying the floor plan, these seemed to be the more expensive one bedroom apartments rather than studio rooms. The other problem was the very high pillows. I had glanced and seen 4 pillows on the bed when I arrived and thought one would surely be suitable. However, when going to bed I found they were all very high and I don’t know why Hotels do this. It is extremely uncomfortable to sleep with your neck kinked at a 90 degree angle. By the time I realised no pillow was suitable it was 11pm and I was already in my pyjamas, so was too embarrassed to be calling anyone at that stage and just put up with it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but away from Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed a couple of nights after a friend's wedding in the city.
reviews.title: Delicious dinner and gorgeous accommodation at Fraser Suites

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience and can't really fault anything! The rooms are extremely sophisticated, comfortable, and everything is brand new. We had a fabulous view of the river which made our stay even better. The staff are friendly and accommodating. We peek in at the gym and pool area and WOW!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We had dinner on our last night in the restaurant there called The Dining Room and it was one of the best dinners we had. I especially loved the lamb dish with the pistascio topping. The breakfast was also very good. Really great food, we are kicking ourselves for not eating there more.
reviews.title: Comfortable and secure

reviews.text: We checked into the fraser suites while attending a conference in Perth.
reviews.title: Really very good!

reviews.text: Whilst we had booked a double room we were pleasantly surprised to be given a one bed room apartment.
reviews.title: All the gloss of a new hotel, pity about the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a long weekend in a one bedroom apartment. It was very modern with a functional kitchen with Microwave and hotplates, lounge, dining area and desk. The separate bedroom also had a wall mounted TV which was good. Lovely modern bathroom. We only paid $199 per night which was a Mothers Day Special.
reviews.title: Modern with a river view!

reviews.text: The location was a little out of the city centre but a bus goes right past the door so that wasn't a problem. We were on level 10 so we had a good view of the river.
reviews.title: Good Perth Option

reviews.text: There are walking and bike tracks along the river and we walked to Belmont Racetrack which was only a few kilometres. Fraser Suites do have bikes for hire if you want them.
reviews.title: I'll stay here again

reviews.text: Staff came to service our aparment on the second day but, as I was in the shower we asked if they could come back later but they never came back.
reviews.title: Great first Fraser experience

reviews.text: The next day they did service the apartment but didn't empty the kitchen bin which was full.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel but reception staff very confused

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the weekend just gone for the "romance" package. We arrived and were told there was some trouble with their system, a few mins later we were able to check in, the room was lovely and clean just really cold. So we tried to get the air con to go up a few degrees had no luck so called reception to be told "just turn it off and the room will get warmer" so we tried to do this. Still no luck so called down to reception again and asked if someone could perhaps come have a look at it was not even switching off! we were told "we can send you up some more blankets" it was only 5pm!! We also asked if we could have the champagne and chocolates that were promised in our package and were told they would be sent up. 40 mins later with the temp dropping below 18 in the room we called and asked if we could move rooms if possible as it was freezing! we were told they would give us a call in a few mins if this was possible. We waited about half and hour and thought we would go down stairs for a drink to warm up, as we got out of the lift an attendant advised he was trying to call us and had arranged for us to move rooms. We were moved to a bigger room on a lower floor which was really nice, we tried to switch the air con to heat but it would not change but at least we were able to turn the air con in that room off which did make the room slightly above freezing being covered in blankets was hardly romantic! We never received the Champagne or chocolates promised in our package. It was a little disappointing as this was our first evening away as a couple since having our first baby a year ago. its lovely and clean just don't stay here if you feel the cold or if you expect service that requires someone to think outside the box!
reviews.title: So much promise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice accomodation but hotel double charged our credit card and now been more than a week in trying to get refund without an apprpriate response. Looks like we now need bank to act for us. Disapointing!!!!!!
reviews.title: Charges

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fraser Suites for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Fraser Suites May 2013

reviews.text: The room was lovely and very modern.
reviews.title: Not 5* that's for sure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfy but the pillows were far too big. We asked for thinner ones and received ones that were exactly the same as the ones on the bed. My poor husband found it hard to sleep because of the pillow :(
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL

description: Overlooking the Swan River, Fraser Suites Perth is ideally situated in this dynamic city. With elegant, modern luxury accommodation the 236 Gold-Standard residences set a new benchmark for accommodation in Australia. Whether for a night or long-term stay, guests can enjoy the most welcoming, personal hospitality at this stylish 5-star apartment hotel. In addition on offer for you is a beautiful heated indoor swimming pool, 24-hour gym, lobby lounge and an alfresco restaurant as well as room service and a business centre. The property also offers 4 function rooms with state of the art facilities and abundant natural light, accommodating up to 380 people in cocktail style.
